solution_line_template: The first round will result in {initial_employees} * {layoff_percent_num}% = <<{initial_employees}*{layoff_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={layoffs_round1}>>{layoffs_round1} employee layoffs.

The second round will result in {remaining_employees_after_round1} * {layoff_percent_num}% = <<{remaining_employees_after_round1}*{layoff_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={layoffs_round2}>>{layoffs_round2} employee layoffs.

The third round will result in {remaining_employees_after_round2} * {layoff_percent_num}% = <<{remaining_employees_after_round2}*{layoff_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={layoffs_round3}>>{layoffs_round3} employee layoffs.
The total number of of employees laid off is {layoffs_round1} + {layoffs_round2} + {layoffs_round3} = <<{layoffs_round1}+{layoffs_round2}+{layoffs_round3}={total_layoffs}>>{total_layoffs}.
